former_owner_as_recorded: On f. 121, rubric for St. John the Baptist "patroni ordinis nostri et ecclesie huius"; Carthusians of Buxheim; in the sale of Hugo, Graf von Waldbott-Bassenheim (Munich, 20 September 1883, lot 2533); Adolph Sutro (1830-1898), mayor of San Francisco.
physical_description: Binding: Bound, s. XVI, in stamped white vellum over wooden boards bevelled to the inside; evidence of 2 fore edge clasps; fore edge leather tabs at major text divisions.|Script, ff. 1-143: Liturgical gothic book hand.|Music, ff. 1-143: Musical notation.|Layout, ff. 1-143: 9 sets of text and 4-line red staves to the page; quires mainly of 8 leaves.
note: Bibliography: De Ricci, p. 26 as n. 3.|ff. 1-143: Contemporary pagination in red roman numerals.|ff. 1-142v; f. 143r-v blank: On ff. 1-110, temporale from Advent to 23rd Sunday after Pentecost; ff. 110-140, sanctorale adds: Francis de Paula, Catherine of Siena, Anthony of Padua, Bonaventure, Agatha, Afra, Bernard, Nicolas of Tolentino, Francis, Bruno, Gallus.
acknowledgements: This description provided by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.
